synthlab.internal
Class BasicModulePool

java.lang.Object
  synthlab.internal.BasicModulePool
All Implemented Interfaces:
ModulePool
public class BasicModulePool
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModulePool

This is the default implementation of the module pool interface

Field Detail

links_

private final com.google.common.collect.BiMap<Port,Port> links_
This map stores the mapping between output and input ports (i.e. links) that are available inside this module pool.

modules_

private final java.util.List<Module> modules_
This is the list of all the owned modules of this pool

uuids_

private final com.google.common.collect.BiMap<java.util.UUID,Module> uuids_
This map associate universely unique ids to ours modules. This is not used at the moment but might be needed in the future if we want to save and restore module pools.

Constructor Detail

BasicModulePool

public BasicModulePool()
Method Detail

contains

public boolean contains(Module module)
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This will return true if the module is present in the pool, false otherwise. Note that this method will check the module itself, not the type of module (you can safely have multiple "VCO" modules in a pool, but not the same VCO instance).

Specified by:
contains in interface ModulePool
Parameters:
module - the module to be searched
Returns:
true if the module is present, false otherwise

getLinks

public com.google.common.collect.BiMap<Port,Port> getLinks()
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This will return all the links currently active between the ports of the modules of this pool. The order in which ports are mapped is not mandatory, but should be output->input in the default implementation. Do NOT change the links!

Specified by:
getLinks in interface ModulePool
Returns:
the mapping between ports (links)

getModules

public java.util.List<Module> getModules()
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This will retrieve the list of all modules currently contained in the pool.

Specified by:
getModules in interface ModulePool
Returns:
the list of all modules currently contained in the pool.

link

public void link(Port p1,
                 Port p2)
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This will link the specified port p1 with p2. You can provide p1 and p2 in any order (input->output or output->input). If either of the two ports were already linked the previous link will be destroyed. If p1 or p2 does not belong to a module contained in this pool, the result is undefined. If either p1 or p2 are null, the result is also undefined.

Specified by:
link in interface ModulePool

linked

public boolean linked(Port p1,
                      Port p2)
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This method will return true if the ports p1 and p2 are linked in this pool. If either p1 or p2 belong to modules outside of this pool, the results are undefined.

Specified by:
linked in interface ModulePool
Returns:

register

public void register(Module module)
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This will register a new module in the pool. Note that the module will not be copied, but rather shared. So you can still edit it after registration. Take care while changing you module to synchronize all accesses to its port values! If the module was already in the pool, nothing happens.

Specified by:
register in interface ModulePool

unlink

public void unlink(Port p1,
                   Port p2)
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This will destroy the link between p1 and p2. If either p1 or p2 does not belong to a module contained by this pool the result is undefined. If either p1 or p2 are null the result is undefined. If p1 and p2 were not previously linked together this method has no effect.

Specified by:
unlink in interface ModulePool

unlinkAll

public void unlinkAll(Module module)
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This method will remove all link to its input ports, and from its output ports. This is usefull if you plan to remove a module from the pool.

Specified by:
unlinkAll in interface ModulePool
Parameters:
module - the module to be completely unlinked

unregister

public void unregister(Module module)
Description copied from interface: ModulePool
This will effectively remove a module from the pool. If the module was not present, nothing happens.

Specified by:
unregister in interface ModulePool
